is an island in the island province of

A taxi from the airport or ferry terminal will cost around US$10-15, whilst the amazing local tuk tuks will set you back around US$5-7, the latter is the most enjoyable of rides and takes about 25-30 min.

Panglao is famous for its world class diving locations and is home to numerous tourist resorts.

Panglao is visited by tourists for the pristine Alona Beach, from where tours can be organised to world famous diving sites.

- there is a tiny lagoon inside a coral cave. Enjoy a dip in a fresh water. The cave is completely dark, the guides have a flashlight. The admission is around 20 PHP. To get here, you can take a bus or mini van towards Panglao island from Tagbilaran. If you tell them you are going to Hinagdanan cave, they will know what intersection to drop you off at.
- boats leave from Alona beach at dawn and will take you to see dolphins having their morning exercises. It is important to book your boat a day ahead of time because the dolphins appear quite early.
are available on the beach. 350 pesos for an hour Swedish massage.

value: directions= Turn left at the beach, walk 500m.

content=Their PADI MSDT instructors teach students from beginners to professionals, plus specialty courses. They also do daily fun dives, dive trips to Balicasag, Pamilacan and Cabilao islands. They have brand new Cressi equipment.
name=Reef Seekers Alona Beach Dive Center
content=Padi Dive center, providing dive courses and daily trips to Balicasag and Pamilacan scuba diving. Aqualung partner center.

Panglao has some small souvenirs that you may want to get but if you want to get something memorable, yet short lived, try the fish, some of the best in the Philippines, the bars and restaurants along the beach are home to it all.

value: content=It is an al fresco restaurant along Alona Beach. Aside from fresh seafood catch, the restaurant serves other varieties like sandwiches, pasta, noodles, chili chicken, beef teriyaki and pork cordon bleu. The bar serves fresh fruit juices, carbonated drinks, beer, wine and cocktails. At night, torches complete the tropical dining atmosphere.
content=Trudi's on the beach is relatively cheap and quite good.

Accommodation on Alona Beach may be considered expensive for budget travellers, but that applies to many beaches in the Philippines.

value: content=Bungalows and well-appointed rooms set in lush surroundings.

content=100 m from Alona Beach. Rooms, casitas, and villas. A/C with a refrigerator, shower, luggage rack, balcony/deck, and internet. The casitas and villas come with more features and include a kitchenette, cableTV, and dining area.
address=Easter A. Lim Drive, Brgy. Tawala

content=6 ocean view villas with king-sized bed, individually-controlled split A/C, wide-screen LCD cableTV, and a mini bar refrigerator. Infinity pool, restaurant with free WiFi, wellness spa, boutique, leisure area, and garden.
content=1.5 km stretch of white sand, the largest shoreline in that area. Large pool and lots of watersport activities.

content=Chill-out Guesthouse Panglao offers fan and airconditioned room with terrace, soft beds and private toilet and bath. Its facilities and services include chillout bar, wireless internet access, tour assistance and massage services.
content=Rooms with private balconies and seaviews.
address=Atlantis Dive Center, Alona Beach, Tawala
content=Cottages with A/C in a huge garden at the far end of Alona Beach. 5 min walk to beach. Nice pool, excellent restaurant and dive centre. Free WiFi.

content=Comfortable rooms, all have A/C with bathroom and a closet. Swimming pools for adults and children, restaurants, and two function rooms. Transfer assistance, boat trips (island hopping and dolphin watching), motorbike rentals, and bohol tour packages.
content=Rooms with balcony, ceiling fans, private toilet and bath. Restaurant, bar, boat and land tours, and internet.
name=Panglao Island Nature Resort and Spa
content=A small cluster of private rooms.

content=Family-owned vacation home. 3 two bedroom, 2.5 bath suites, dining room and kitchen with on-site management, professional security, internet and a car & driver. Each unit has a lanai with views of the ocean.
content=35 rooms, superior, deluxe and standard with contemporary design and architecture, all with full amenities.
content=3 min walk from Alona Beach.
content=Water sport activities, such as scuba diving, snorkelling, and jet skiing. Cliff edge restaurant, jacuzzi, and infinity pool.

content=On Dayo Hill, only 5 km from Tagbilaran, with a 210⁰ view overlooking Bohol and the islands of the Central Visayas. Newly built with 6 apartments and 8 hotel rooms. The apartments are about 65-90² m and include a spacious roofed terrace and kitchen with cooking facilities. Hotel rooms are about 44² m. Both the hotel rooms and apartments have A/C, refrigerator, cableTV, DVD player, free internet and safety deposit box.

content=Oasis Resort's restaurant, probably the best food around. It covers Thai, Mexican, Italian, Japanese among others styles yet they are all great. Really surprising to find such good quality food after trying so many different places at Alona beach. Give it a try at Chili Con Carne or Fish Yellow Curry! Just beside Seaquest Dive Center at the beach walk.

- This is a money changer, internet café and souvenir shop located near the police office just off of Alona Beach. Credit cards should not be used there, as credit card number thefts have been reported by tourists after using it at that place.
